member.name: T:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.Series
member.summary:
The Series object is the JavaScript representation of each line, area series, pie etc.

The object can be accessed in a number of ways. All series and point event handlers give a reference to the series object. The chart object has a series property that is a collection of all the chart's series. The point objects also have the same reference.

Another way to reference the series programmatically is by id. Add an id in the series configuration options, and get the series object by chart.get(id).

Configuration options for the series are given in three levels. Options for all series in a chart are given in the plotOptions.series object. Then options for all series of a specific type are given in the plotOptions of that type, for example plotOptions.line. Next, options for one single series are given in the series array.

member.name: T:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.Renderer
member.summary:
Allows direct access to the Highcharts rendering layer in order to draw primitive shapes like circles, rectangles,paths or text directly on a chart, or independent from any chart. The Renderer represents a wrapper object for SVGin modern browsers and VML in IE < 8.

An existing chart's renderer can be accessed through chart.renderer. To create a renderer independent from a chart, use var renderer = new Highcharts.Renderer(parentNode, width, height); where parentNode is the HTML element where you want to add it.

The Renderer's methods are chained wherever possible, so you can initiate an element then call for example attr and css and add on that element in one statement.

Annotating a chart programmatically, independent SVG/VML drawing

member.name: T:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.Point
member.summary:
The Point object is the JavaScript representation of each data point

The object can be accessed in a number of ways. In all point event handlers the point object is this. In the series object all the points are accessed by the series.data array.

Another way to reference the point programmatically is by id. Add an id in the point configuration options, and get the point object by chart.get(id).

member.summary: A hook for defining additional date format specifiers. New specifiers are defined as key-value pairs by using the specifier as key, and a function which takes the timestamp as value. This function returns the formatted portion of the date.

member.summary: An array containing the current chart objects in the page. A chart's position in the array is preserved throughout the page's lifetime. When a chart is destroyed, the array item becomes undefined.

member.name: T:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.Element
member.summary: The Element class is a JavaScript wrapper for SVG elements used in the rendering layer of Highchart. Combined with the Renderer object, these elements allows freeform annotation in the charts or even in your HTML pages without creating a chart at all.

member.name: T:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.Chart
member.summary:
The chart object is the JavaScript object representing a single chart in the web page.The pointer to your chart object is returned when a chart is created using the Highcharts.Chart() constructor:

var chart1 = new Highcharts.Chart(options);

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.Chart.XAxis

member.name: T:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.Axis
member.summary:
A chart can have from 0 axes (pie chart) to multiples. In a normal, single series cartesian chart, there is one X axis and one Y axis.

The X axis or axes are referenced by chart.xAxis, which is an array of Axis objects. If there is only one axis, it can be referenced through chart.xAxis[0], and multiple axes have increasing indices. The same pattern goes for Y axes.

If you need to get the axes from a series object, use the series.xAxis andseries.yAxis properties. These are not arrays, as one series can only be associated to one X and one Y axis.

A third way to reference the axis programmatically is by id. Add an id in the axis configuration options, and get the axis by chart.get(id).

Configuration options for the axes are given in options.xAxis and options.yAxis.

member.name: T:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.ChartEventsCfg
member.summary: Event listeners for the chart.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.ChartEventsCfg.Selection
member.summary:
Fires when an area of the chart has been selected. Selection is enabled by setting the chart's zoomType. The this keyword refers to the chart object itself. One parameter, event, is passed to the function. This contains common event information based on jQuery or MooTools depending on which library is used as the base for Highcharts. The default action for the selection event is to zoom the chart to the selected area. It can be prevented by calling event.preventDefault().

Information on the selected area can be found through event.xAxis and event.yAxis, which are arrays containing the axes of each dimension and each axis' min and max values. The primary axes are event.xAxis[0] and event.yAxis[0]. Remember the unit of a datetime axis is milliseconds since 1970-01-01 00:00:00.

selection: function(event) {
	// log the min and max of the primary, datetime x-axis
	console.log(
		Highcharts.dateFormat('%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S', event.xAxis[0].min),
		Highcharts.dateFormat('%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S', event.xAxis[0].max)
	);
	// log the min and max of the y axis
	console.log(event.yAxis[0].min, event.yAxis[0].max);
}

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.ChartEventsCfg.Redraw
member.summary: Fires when the chart is redrawn, either after a call to chart.redraw() or after an axis, series or point is modified with the redraw option set to true. The this keyword refers to the chart object itself. One parameter, event, is passed to the function. This contains common event information based on jQuery or MooTools depending on which library is used as the base for Highcharts.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.ChartEventsCfg.Load
member.summary:
Fires when the chart is finished loading. The this keyword refers to the chart object itself. One parameter, event, is passed to the function. This contains common event information based on jQuery or MooTools depending on which library is used as the base for Highcharts.

From version 2.0.4, there is also a second parameter to Highcharts.Chart where a callback function can be passed to be executed on chart.load.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.ChartEventsCfg.Drillup
member.summary: Fires when drilling up from a drilldown series.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.ChartEventsCfg.Drilldown
member.summary:
Fires when a drilldown point is clicked, before the new series is added. Event arguments include point for the originating point, and seriesOptions for the new series.

This event is also utilized for async drilldown, where the seriesOptions are not added by option, but rather loaded async.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.ChartEventsCfg.Click
member.summary:
Fires when clicking on the plot background. The this keyword refers to the chart object itself. One parameter, event, is passed to the function. This contains common event information based on jQuery or MooTools depending on which library is used as the base for Highcharts.

Information on the clicked spot can be found through event.xAxis and event.yAxis, which are arrays containing the axes of each dimension and each axis' value at the clicked spot. The primary axes are event.xAxis[0] and event.yAxis[0]. Remember the unit of a datetime axis is milliseconds since 1970-01-01 00:00:00.

click: function(e) {
	console.log(
		Highcharts.dateFormat('%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S', e.xAxis[0].value), 
		e.yAxis[0].value
	)
}

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.ChartEventsCfg.AddSeries
member.summary: Fires when a series is added to the chart after load time, using the addSeries method. The this keyword refers to the chart object itself. One parameter, event, is passed to the function. This contains common event information based on jQuery or MooTools depending on which library is used as the base for Highcharts. Through event.options you can access the series options that was passed to the addSeries method. Returning false prevents the series from being added.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.ChartCfg.MarginRight
member.summary: The margin between the right outer edge of the chart and the plot area. Use this to set a fixed pixel value for the margin as opposed to the default dynamic margin. See also spacingRight.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.ChartCfg.MarginLeft

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.ChartCfg.Margin
member.summary:
The margin between the outer edge of the chart and the plot area. The numbers in the array designate top, right, bottom and left respectively. Use the options marginTop, marginRight, marginBottom and marginLeft for shorthand setting of one option.

Since version 2.1, the margin is 0 by default. The actual space is dynamically calculated from the offset of axis labels, axis title, title, subtitle and legend in addition to the spacingTop, spacingRight, spacingBottom and spacingLeft options.

Defaults to [null].

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.ChartCfg.Inverted
member.summary: Whether to invert the axes so that the x axis is vertical and y axis is horizontal. When true, the x axis is reversed by default. If a bar series is present in the chart, it will be inverted automatically.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.ChartCfg.IgnoreHiddenSeries
member.summary: If true, the axes will scale to the remaining visible series once one series is hidden. If false, hiding and showing a series will not affect the axes or the other series. For stacks, once one series within the stack is hidden, the rest of the stack will close in around it even if the axis is not affected.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.ChartCfg.Height
member.summary: An explicit height for the chart. By default the height is calculated from the offset height of the containing element, or 400 pixels if the containing element's height is 0.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.ChartCfg.ClassName
member.summary: A CSS class name to apply to the charts container div, allowing unique CSS styling for each chart.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.ChartCfg.BorderWidth
member.summary: The pixel width of the outer chart border. The border is painted using vector graphic techniques to allow rounded corners.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.ChartCfg.BorderRadius
member.summary: The corner radius of the outer chart border. In export, the radius defaults to 0.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.ChartCfg.BorderColor
member.summary: The color of the outer chart border. The border is painted using vector graphic techniques to allow rounded corners.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.ChartCfg.BackgroundColor
member.summary: The background color or gradient for the outer chart area.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.ChartCfg.Animation
member.summary:
Set the overall animation for all chart updating. Animation can be disabled throughout the chart by setting it to false here. It can be overridden for each individual API method as a function parameter. The only animation not affected by this option is the initial series animation, see plotOptions.series.animation.

The animation can either be set as a boolean or a configuration object. If true, it will use the 'swing' jQuery easing and a duration of 500 ms. If used as a configuration object, the following properties are supported:

duration
The duration of the animation in milliseconds.
easing
When using jQuery as the general framework, the easing can be set to linear or swing. More easing functions are available with the use of jQuery plug-ins, most notably the jQuery UI suite. See the jQuery docs. When using MooTools as the general framework, use the property name transition instead of easing.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.ChartCfg.AlignTicks
member.summary: When using multiple axis, the ticks of two or more opposite axes will automatically be aligned by adding ticks to the axis or axes with the least ticks. This can be prevented by setting alignTicks to false. If the grid lines look messy, it's a good idea to hide them for the secondary axis by setting gridLineWidth to 0.

member.name: T:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.ColorsCfg
member.summary:
An array containing the default colors for the chart's series. When all colors are used, new colors are pulled from the start again. Defaults to: 

colors: ['#7cb5ec', '#434348', '#90ed7d', '#f7a35c', '#8085e9', 
   '#f15c80', '#e4d354', '#8085e8', '#8d4653', '#91e8e1']
Default colors can also be set on a series or series.type basis, see column.colors, pie.colors.

Legacy

In Highcharts 3.x, the default colors were: 

colors: ['#2f7ed8', '#0d233a', '#8bbc21', '#910000', '#1aadce', 
   '#492970', '#f28f43', '#77a1e5', '#c42525', '#a6c96a']

In Highcharts 2.x, the default colors were: 

colors: ['#4572A7', '#AA4643', '#89A54E', '#80699B', '#3D96AE', 
   '#DB843D', '#92A8CD', '#A47D7C', '#B5CA92']

member.name: T:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.CreditsCfg

member.name: T:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.DrilldownCfg
member.summary:
Options for drill down, the concept of inspecting increasingly high resolution data through clicking on chart items like columns or pie slices.

The drilldown feature requires the drilldown.js file to be loaded, found in the modules directory of the download package, or online at code.highcharts.com/modules/drilldown.js.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.DrilldownCfg.Series
member.summary: An array of series configurations for the drill down. Each series configuration uses the same syntax as the series option set. These drilldown series are hidden by default. The drilldown series is linked to the parent series' point by its id.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.DrilldownCfg.Animation
member.summary:
Set the animation for all drilldown animations. Animation of a drilldown occurs when drilling between a column point and a column series, or a pie slice and a full pie series. Drilldown can still be used between series and points of different types, but animation will not occur.

The animation can either be set as a boolean or a configuration object. If true, it will use the 'swing' jQuery easing and a duration of 500 ms. If used as a configuration object, the following properties are supported:

duration
The duration of the animation in milliseconds.
easing
When using jQuery as the general framework, the easing can be set to linear or swing. More easing functions are available with the use of jQuery plug-ins, most notably the jQuery UI suite. See the jQuery docs. When using MooTools as the general framework, use the property name transition instead of easing.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.DrilldownCfg.ActiveDataLabelStyle
member.summary:
Additional styles to apply to the data label of a point that has drilldown data. By default it is underlined and blue to invite to interaction. Defaults to: 
activeAxisLabelStyle: {
	cursor: 'pointer',

	fontWeight: 'bold',
	textDecoration: 'underline'			
}

Additional styles to apply to the X axis label for a point that has drilldown data. By default it is underlined and blue to invite to interaction. Defaults to:

member.summary: Options for the export button.

member.summary: See navigation.buttonOptions => symbolFill.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.ExportingButtonsContextButtonCfg.Symbol
member.summary: The symbol for the button. Points to a definition function in the Highcharts.Renderer.symbols collection. The default exportIcon function is part of the exporting module.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.ExportingButtonsContextButtonCfg.Onclick
member.summary: A click handler callback to use on the button directly instead of the popup menu.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.ExportingButtonsContextButtonCfg.MenuItems
member.summary:
A collection of config options for the menu items. Each options object consists of a text option which is a string to show in the menu item, as well as an onclick parameter which is a callback function to run on click.

By default, there is the "Print" menu item plus one menu item for each of the available export types. Menu items can be customized by defining a new array of items and assigning null to unwanted positions (see override example below).

member.name: T:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.ExportingButtonsCfg
member.summary: Options for the export related buttons, print and export. In addition to the default buttons listed here, custom buttons can be added. See navigation.buttonOptions for general options.

member.name: T:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.ExportingCfg
member.summary: Options for the exporting module. For an overview on the matter, see the docs.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.ExportingCfg.Width
member.summary: The pixel width of charts exported to PNG or JPG. As of Highcharts 3.0, the default pixel width is a function of the chart.width or exporting.sourceWidth and the exporting.scale.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.ExportingCfg.Url
member.summary: The URL for the server module converting the SVG string to an image format. By default this points to Highslide Software's free web service.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.ExportingCfg.Type
member.summary: Default MIME type for exporting if chart.exportChart() is called without specifying a type option. Possible values are image/png, image/jpeg, application/pdf and image/svg+xml.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.ExportingCfg.SourceWidth
member.summary: The width of the original chart when exported, unless an explicit chart.width is set. The width exported raster image is then multiplied by scale.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.ExportingCfg.SourceHeight
member.summary: Analogous to sourceWidth

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.ExportingCfg.Scale
member.summary: Defines the scale or zoom factor for the exported image compared to the on-screen display. While for instance a 600px wide chart may look good on a website, it will look bad in print. The default scale of 2 makes this chart export to a 1200px PNG or JPG.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.ExportingCfg.FormAttributes
member.summary: An object containing additional attributes for the POST form that sends the SVG to the export server. For example, a target can be set to make sure the generated image is received in another frame, or a custom enctype or encoding can be set.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.ExportingCfg.Filename
member.summary: The filename, without extension, to use for the exported chart.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.ExportingCfg.Enabled
member.summary: Whether to enable the exporting module. Disabling the module will hide the context button, but API methods will still be available.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.ExportingCfg.ChartOptions
member.summary: Additional chart options to be merged into an exported chart. For example, the exported chart can be given a specific width and height, or a printer-friendly color scheme.

member.name: T:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.LabelsItemsCfg
member.summary: A HTML label that can be positioned anywhere in the chart area.

member.summary: Inner HTML or text for the label.

T:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.LegendCfg
member.summary: The legend is a box containing a symbol and name for each series item or point item in the chart.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.LegendCfg.Y
member.summary: The vertical offset of the legend relative to it's vertical alignment verticalAlign within chart.spacingTop and chart.spacingBottom. Negative y moves it up, positive y moves it down.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.LegendCfg.X
member.summary: The x offset of the legend relative to it's horizontal alignment align within chart.spacingLeft and chart.spacingRight. Negative x moves it to the left, positive x moves it to the right.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.LegendCfg.Width
member.summary: The width of the legend box.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.LegendCfg.VerticalAlign
member.summary: The vertical alignment of the legend box. Can be one of "top", "middle" or "bottom". Vertical position can be further determined by the y option.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.LegendCfg.UseHTML
member.summary: Whether to use HTML to render the legend item texts. When using HTML, legend.navigation is disabled.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.LegendCfg.SymbolWidth
member.summary: The pixel width of the legend item symbol.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.LegendCfg.SymbolRadius
member.summary: The border radius of the symbol for series types that use a rectangle in the legend.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.LegendCfg.SymbolPadding
member.summary: The pixel padding between the legend item symbol and the legend item text.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.LegendCfg.SymbolHeight
member.summary: The pixel height of the symbol for series types that use a rectangle in the legend.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.LegendCfg.Shadow
member.summary: Whether to apply a drop shadow to the legend. A backgroundColor also needs to be applied for this to take effect. Since 2.3 the shadow can be an object configuration containing color, offsetX, offsetY, opacity and width.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.LegendCfg.Rtl
member.summary: Whether to show the symbol on the right side of the text rather than the left side. This is common in Arabic and Hebraic.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.LegendCfg.Reversed
member.summary: Whether to reverse the order of the legend items compared to the order of the series or points as defined in the configuration object.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.LegendCfg.Padding
member.summary: The inner padding of the legend box.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.LegendCfg.MaxHeight
member.summary: Maximum pixel height for the legend. When the maximum height is extended, navigation will show.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.LegendCfg.Margin
member.summary: If the plot area sized is calculated automatically and the legend is not floating, the legend margin is the space between the legend and the axis labels or plot area.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.LegendCfg.LineHeight
member.summary: Line height for the legend items. Deprecated as of 2.1. Instead, the line height for each item can be set using itemStyle.lineHeight, and the padding between items using itemMarginTop and itemMarginBottom.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.LegendCfg.Layout
member.summary: The layout of the legend items. Can be one of "horizontal" or "vertical".

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.LegendCfg.LabelFormatter
member.summary: Callback function to format each of the series' labels. The this keyword refers to the series object, or the point object in case of pie charts. By default the series or point name is printed.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.LegendCfg.LabelFormat
member.summary: A format string for each legend label. Available variables relates to properties on the series, or the point in case of pies.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.LegendCfg.ItemWidth
member.summary: The width for each legend item. This is useful in a horizontal layout with many items when you want the items to align vertically. .

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.LegendCfg.ItemStyle
member.summary: CSS styles for each legend item. Only a subset of CSS is supported, notably those options related to text.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.LegendCfg.ItemMarginTop
member.summary: The pixel top margin for each legend item.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.LegendCfg.ItemMarginBottom
member.summary: The pixel bottom margin for each legend item.

member.summary: In a legend with horizontal layout, the itemDistance defines the pixel distance between each item.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.LegendCfg.Floating
member.summary: When the legend is floating, the plot area ignores it and is allowed to be placed below it.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.LegendCfg.Enabled
member.summary: Enable or disable the legend.

member.summary: The width of the drawn border around the legend.

member.summary: The border corner radius of the legend.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.LegendCfg.BorderColor
member.summary: The color of the drawn border around the legend.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.LegendCfg.BackgroundColor
member.summary: The background color of the legend, filling the rounded corner border.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.LegendCfg.Align
member.summary: The horizontal alignment of the legend box within the chart area. Valid values are "left", "center" and "right".

member.name: T:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.LoadingCfg
member.summary: The loading options control the appearance of the loading screen that covers the plot area on chart operations. This screen only appears after an explicit call to chart.showLoading(). It is a utility for developers to communicate to the end user that something is going on, for example while retrieving new data via an XHR connection. The "Loading..." text itself is not part of this configuration object, but part of the lang object.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.LoadingCfg.Style
member.summary:
CSS styles for the loading screen that covers the plot area. Defaults to: 
style: {
	position: 'absolute',
	backgroundColor: 'white',
	opacity: 0.5,
	textAlign: 'center'
}

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.LoadingCfg.ShowDuration

member.summary: CSS styles for the loading label span.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.LoadingCfg.HideDuration
member.summary: The duration in milliseconds of the fade out effect.

member.summary: Options for displaying a message like "No data to display". This feature requires the file no-data-to-display.js to be loaded in the page. The actual text to display is set in the lang.noData option.

member.summary: CSS styles for the no-data label.

member.name: T:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.PaneCfg
member.summary: Applies only to polar charts and angular gauges. This configuration object holds general options for the combined X and Y axes set. Each xAxis or yAxis can reference the pane by index.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.PaneCfg.StartAngle
member.summary: The start angle of the polar X axis or gauge axis, given in degrees where 0 is north. Defaults to 0.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.PaneCfg.EndAngle
member.summary: The end angle of the polar X axis or gauge value axis, given in degrees where 0 is north. Defaults to startAngle + 360.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.PaneCfg.Center
member.summary: The center of a polar chart or angular gauge, given as an array of [x, y] positions. Positions can be given as integers that transform to pixels, or as percentages of the plot area size.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.PaneCfg.Background
member.summary: An object, or array of objects, for backgrounds. Sub options include backgroundColor (can be solid or gradient), shape ("solid" or "arc"), innerWidth, outerWidth, borderWidth, borderColor.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.PlotOptionsAreaCfg.TrackByArea
member.summary: Whether the whole area or just the line should respond to mouseover tooltips and other mouse or touch events.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.PlotOptionsAreaCfg.Threshold
member.summary: The Y axis value to serve as the base for the area, for distinguishing between values above and below a threshold. If null, the area behaves like a line series with fill between the graph and the Y axis minimum.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.PlotOptionsAreaCfg.NegativeFillColor
member.summary: A separate color for the negative part of the area.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.PlotOptionsAreaCfg.LineColor
member.summary: A separate color for the graph line. By default the line takes the color of the series, but the lineColor setting allows setting a separate color for the line without altering the fillColor.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.PlotOptionsAreaCfg.FillOpacity
member.summary: Fill opacity for the area.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.PlotOptionsAreaCfg.FillColor
member.summary: Fill color or gradient for the area. When null, the series' color is used with the series' fillOpacity.

member.name: T:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.PlotOptionsArearangeDataLabelsCfg
member.summary: Extended data labels for range series types. Range series data labels have no x and y options. Instead, they have xLow, xHigh, yLow and yHigh options to allow the higher and lower data label sets individually.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.PlotOptionsArearangeDataLabelsCfg.YLow
member.summary: Y offset of the lower data labels relative to the point value.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.PlotOptionsArearangeDataLabelsCfg.YHigh
member.summary: Y offset of the higher data labels relative to the point value.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.PlotOptionsArearangeDataLabelsCfg.XLow
member.summary: X offset of the lower data labels relative to the point value.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.PlotOptionsArearangeDataLabelsCfg.XHigh
member.summary: X offset of the higher data labels relative to the point value.

member.name: T:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.PlotOptionsArearangeCfg
member.summary: The area range is a cartesian series type with higher and lower Y values along an X axis. Requires highcharts-more.js.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.PlotOptionsArearangeCfg.TrackByArea
member.summary: Whether the whole area or just the line should respond to mouseover tooltips and other mouse or touch events.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.PlotOptionsArearangeCfg.Shadow
member.summary: Whether to apply a drop shadow to the graph line. Since 2.3 the shadow can be an object configuration containing color, offsetX, offsetY, opacity and width.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.PlotOptionsArearangeCfg.LineWidth
member.summary: Pixel width of the arearange graph line.

member.name: T:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.PlotOptionsAreasplinerangeCfg
member.summary: The area spline range is a cartesian series type with higher and lower Y values along an X axis. Requires highcharts-more.js.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.PlotOptionsBarDataLabelsCfg.X
member.summary: The x position of the data label relative to the data point.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.PlotOptionsBarDataLabelsCfg.Align
member.summary: Alignment of the data label relative to the data point.

member.name: T:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.PlotOptionsBoxplotCfg
member.summary: A box plot is a convenient way of depicting groups of data through their five-number summaries: the smallest observation (sample minimum), lower quartile (Q1), median (Q2), upper quartile (Q3), and largest observation (sample maximum).

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.PlotOptionsBoxplotCfg.WhiskerWidth
member.summary: The line width of the whiskers, the horizontal lines marking low and high values. When null, the general lineWidth applies.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.PlotOptionsBoxplotCfg.WhiskerLength
member.summary: The length of the whiskers, the horizontal lines marking low and high values. It can be a numerical pixel value, or a percentage value of the box width. Set 0 to disable whiskers.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.PlotOptionsBoxplotCfg.WhiskerColor
member.summary: The color of the whiskers, the horizontal lines marking low and high values. When null, the general series color is used.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.PlotOptionsBoxplotCfg.StemWidth
member.summary: The width of the stem, the vertical line extending from the box to the whiskers. If null, the width is inherited from the lineWidth option.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.PlotOptionsBoxplotCfg.StemDashStyle
member.summary: The dash style of the stem, the vertical line extending from the box to the whiskers.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.PlotOptionsBoxplotCfg.StemColor
member.summary: The color of the stem, the vertical line extending from the box to the whiskers. If null, the series color is used.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.PlotOptionsBoxplotCfg.MedianWidth
member.summary: The pixel width of the median line. If null, the lineWidth is used.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.PlotOptionsBoxplotCfg.MedianColor
member.summary: The color of the median line. If null, the general series color applies.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.PlotOptionsBoxplotCfg.LineWidth
member.summary: The width of the line surrounding the box. If any of stemWidth, medianWidth or whiskerWidth are null, the lineWidth also applies to these lines.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.PlotOptionsBoxplotCfg.FillColor
member.summary: The fill color of the box.

member.name: T:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.PlotOptionsBubbleCfg
member.summary: A bubble series is a three dimensional series type where each point renders an X, Y and Z value. Each points is drawn as a bubble where the position along the X and Y axes mark the X and Y values, and the size of the bubble relates to the Z value.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.PlotOptionsBubbleCfg.ZThreshold
member.summary: When displayNegative is false, bubbles with lower Z values are skipped. When displayNegative is true and a negativeColor is given, points with lower Z is colored.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.PlotOptionsBubbleCfg.ZMin
member.summary: The minimum for the Z value range. Defaults to the lowest Z value in the data.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.PlotOptionsBubbleCfg.ZMax
member.summary: The minimum for the Z value range. Defaults to the highest Z value in the data.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.PlotOptionsBubbleCfg.SizeBy
member.summary: Whether the bubble's value should be represented by the area or the width of the bubble. The default, area, corresponds best to the human perception of the size of each bubble.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.PlotOptionsBubbleCfg.NegativeColor
member.summary: When a point's Z value is below the zThreshold setting, this color is used.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.PlotOptionsBubbleCfg.MinSize
member.summary: Minimum bubble size. Bubbles will automatically size between the minSize and maxSize to reflect the z value of each bubble. Can be either pixels (when no unit is given), or a percentage of the smallest one of the plot width and height.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.PlotOptionsBubbleCfg.MaxSize
member.summary: Maximum bubble size. Bubbles will automatically size between the minSize and maxSize to reflect the z value of each bubble. Can be either pixels (when no unit is given), or a percentage of the smallest one of the plot width and height.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.PlotOptionsBubbleCfg.DisplayNegative
member.summary: Whether to display negative sized bubbles. The threshold is given by the zThreshold option, and negative bubbles can be visualized by setting negativeColor.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.PlotOptionsColumnCfg.Threshold
member.summary: The Y axis value to serve as the base for the columns, for distinguishing between values above and below a threshold. If null, the columns extend from the padding Y axis minimum.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.PlotOptionsColumnCfg.PointWidth
member.summary: A pixel value specifying a fixed width for each column or bar. When null, the width is calculated from the pointPadding and groupPadding.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.PlotOptionsColumnCfg.PointRange
member.summary: The X axis range that each point is valid for. This determines the width of the column. On a categorized axis, the range will be 1 by default (one category unit). On linear and datetime axes, the range will be computed as the distance between the two closest data points.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.PlotOptionsColumnCfg.PointPadding
member.summary: Padding between each column or bar, in x axis units.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.PlotOptionsColumnCfg.MinPointLength
member.summary: The minimal height for a column or width for a bar. By default, 0 values are not shown. To visualize a 0 (or close to zero) point, set the minimal point length to a pixel value like 3. In stacked column charts, minPointLength might not be respected for tightly packed values.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.PlotOptionsColumnCfg.Grouping
member.summary: Whether to group non-stacked columns or to let them render independent of each other. Non-grouped columns will be laid out individually and overlap each other.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.PlotOptionsColumnCfg.GroupZPadding
member.summary: The spacing between columns on the Z Axis in a 3D chart. Requires highcharts-3d.js.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.PlotOptionsColumnCfg.GroupPadding
member.summary: Padding between each value groups, in x axis units.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.PlotOptionsColumnCfg.EdgeWidth
member.summary: 3D columns only. The width of the colored edges.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.PlotOptionsColumnCfg.EdgeColor
member.summary: 3D columns only. The color of the edges. Similar to borderColor, except it defaults to the same color as the column.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.PlotOptionsColumnCfg.Depth
member.summary: Depth of the columns in a 3D column chart. Requires highcharts-3d.js.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.PlotOptionsColumnCfg.CropThreshold
member.summary: When the series contains less points than the crop threshold, all points are drawn, event if the points fall outside the visible plot area at the current zoom. The advantage of drawing all points (including markers and columns), is that animation is performed on updates. On the other hand, when the series contains more points than the crop threshold, the series data is cropped to only contain points that fall within the plot area. The advantage of cropping away invisible points is to increase performance on large series. .

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.PlotOptionsColumnCfg.Colors
member.summary: A series specific or series type specific color set to apply instead of the global colors when colorByPoint is true.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.PlotOptionsColumnCfg.ColorByPoint
member.summary: When using automatic point colors pulled from the options.colors collection, this option determines whether the chart should receive one color per series or one color per point.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.PlotOptionsColumnCfg.BorderWidth
member.summary: The width of the border surrounding each column or bar.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.PlotOptionsColumnCfg.BorderRadius
member.summary: The corner radius of the border surrounding each column or bar.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.PlotOptionsColumnCfg.BorderColor
member.summary: The color of the border surrounding each column or bar.

member.name: T:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.PlotOptionsColumnrangeDataLabelsCfg
member.summary: Extended data labels for range series types. Range series data labels have no x and y options. Instead, they have xLow, xHigh, yLow and yHigh options to allow the higher and lower data label sets individually.

member.name: T:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.PlotOptionsColumnrangeCfg
member.summary: The column range is a cartesian series type with higher and lower Y values along an X axis. Requires highcharts-more.js. To display horizontal bars, set chart.inverted to true.

member.name: T:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.PlotOptionsErrorbarCfg
member.summary: Error bars are a graphical representation of the variability of data and are used on graphs to indicate the error, or uncertainty in a reported measurement.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.PlotOptionsErrorbarCfg.WhiskerWidth
member.summary: The line width of the whiskers, the horizontal lines marking low and high values. When null, the general lineWidth applies.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.PlotOptionsErrorbarCfg.LinkedTo
member.summary: The parent series of the error bar. The default value links it to the previous series. Otherwise, use the id of the parent series.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.PlotOptionsErrorbarCfg.Color
member.summary: The main color of the bars. This can be overridden by stemColor and whiskerColor individually.

member.name: T:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.PlotOptionsFunnelCfg
member.summary: Funnel charts are a type of chart often used to visualize stages in a sales project, where the top are the initial stages with the most clients. It requires that the modules/funnel.js file is loaded.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.PlotOptionsFunnelCfg.Width
member.summary: The width of the funnel compared to the width of the plot area, or the pixel width if it is a number.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.PlotOptionsFunnelCfg.Reversed
member.summary: A reversed funnel has the widest area down. A reversed funnel with no neck width and neck height is a pyramid.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.PlotOptionsFunnelCfg.NeckWidth
member.summary: The width of the neck, the lower part of the funnel. A number defines pixel width, a percentage string defines a percentage of the plot area width.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.PlotOptionsFunnelCfg.NeckHeight
member.summary: The height of the neck, the lower part of the funnel. A number defines pixel width, a percentage string defines a percentage of the plot area height.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.PlotOptionsFunnelCfg.Height
member.summary: The height of the neck, the lower part of a funnel. If it is a number it defines the pixel height, if it is a percentage string it is the percentage of the plot area height.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.PlotOptionsFunnelCfg.Center
member.summary: The center of the funnel. By default, it is centered in the middle of the plot area, so it fills the plot area height.

member.name: T:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.PlotOptionsGaugeDataLabelsCfg

member.summary: The radius or length of the dial, in percentages relative to the radius of the gauge itself.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.PlotOptionsGaugeDialCfg.BaseLength
member.summary: The length of the dial's base part, relative to the total radius or length of the dial.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.PlotOptionsGaugeDialCfg.BackgroundColor
member.summary: The background or fill color of the gauge's dial.

member.summary: Options for the pivot or the center point of the gauge.

member.summary: The pixel radius of the pivot.

member.summary: The border or stroke width of the pivot.

member.summary: The background color or fill of the pivot.

member.name: T:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.PlotOptionsGaugeCfg
member.summary: General plotting options for the gauge series type. Requires highcharts-more.js

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.PlotOptionsGaugeCfg.Wrap
member.summary: When this option is true, the dial will wrap around the axes. For instance, in a full-range gauge going from 0 to 360, a value of 400 will point to 40. When wrap is false, the dial stops at 360.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.PlotOptionsGaugeCfg.ShowInLegend
member.summary: Whether to display this particular series or series type in the legend. Defaults to false for gauge series.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.PlotOptionsGaugeCfg.Overshoot
member.summary: Allow the dial to overshoot the end of the perimeter axis by this many degrees. Say if the gauge axis goes from 0 to 60, a value of 100, or 1000, will show 5 degrees beyond the end of the axis.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.PlotOptionsLineCfg.Step
member.summary: Whether to apply steps to the line. Possible values are left, center and right. Prior to 2.3.5, only left was supported.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.PlotOptionsPieDataLabelsCfg.SoftConnector
member.summary: Whether to render the connector as a soft arc or a line with sharp break.

member.summary: Enable or disable the data labels.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.PlotOptionsPieDataLabelsCfg.Distance
member.summary: The distance of the data label from the pie's edge. Negative numbers put the data label on top of the pie slices. Connectors are only shown for data labels outside the pie.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.PlotOptionsPieDataLabelsCfg.ConnectorWidth
member.summary: The width of the line connecting the data label to the pie slice.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.PlotOptionsPieDataLabelsCfg.ConnectorPadding
member.summary: The distance from the data label to the connector.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.PlotOptionsPieDataLabelsCfg.ConnectorColor
member.summary: The color of the line connecting the data label to the pie slice. The default color is the same as the point's color.

member.summary: N/A for pies.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.PlotOptionsPieEventsCfg.LegendItemClick
member.summary: Not applicable to pies, as the legend item is per point. See point.events.

member.name: T:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.PlotOptionsPieCfg
member.summary: A pie chart is a circular chart divided into sectors, illustrating numerical proportion.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.PlotOptionsPieCfg.StickyTracking
member.summary: Sticky tracking of mouse events. When true, the mouseOut event on a series isn't triggered until the mouse moves over another series, or out of the plot area. When false, the mouseOut event on a series is triggered when the mouse leaves the area around the series' graph or markers. This also implies the tooltip. When stickyTracking is false and tooltip.shared is false, the tooltip will be hidden when moving the mouse between series.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.PlotOptionsPieCfg.StartAngle
member.summary: The start angle of the pie slices in degrees where 0 is top and 90 right.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.PlotOptionsPieCfg.SlicedOffset
member.summary: If a point is sliced, moved out from the center, how many pixels should it be moved?.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.PlotOptionsPieCfg.Size
member.summary: The diameter of the pie relative to the plot area. Can be a percentage or pixel value. Pixel values are given as integers. The default behaviour (as of 3.0) is to scale to the plot area and give room for data labels within the plot area. As a consequence, the size of the pie may vary when points are updated and data labels more around. In that case it is best to set a fixed value, for example "75%".

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.PlotOptionsPieCfg.ShowInLegend
member.summary: Whether to display this particular series or series type in the legend. Since 2.1, pies are not shown in the legend by default.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.PlotOptionsPieCfg.MinSize
member.summary: The minimum size for a pie in response to auto margins. The pie will try to shrink to make room for data labels in side the plot area, but only to this size.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.PlotOptionsPieCfg.InnerSize
member.summary: The size of the inner diameter for the pie. A size greater than 0 renders a donut chart. Can be a percentage or pixel value. Percentages are relative to the size of the plot area. Pixel values are given as integers.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.PlotOptionsPieCfg.IgnoreHiddenPoint
member.summary:
Equivalent to chart.ignoreHiddenSeries, this option tells whether the series shall be redrawn as if the hidden point were null.

The default value changed from false to true with Highcharts 3.0.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.PlotOptionsPieCfg.EndAngle
member.summary: The end angle of the pie in degrees where 0 is top and 90 is right. Defaults to startAngle plus 360.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.PlotOptionsPieCfg.Depth
member.summary: The thickness of a 3D pie. Requires highcharts-3d.js

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.PlotOptionsPieCfg.Colors
member.summary: A series specific or series type specific color set to use instead of the global colors.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.PlotOptionsPieCfg.Center
member.summary: The center of the pie chart relative to the plot area. Can be percentages or pixel values. The default behaviour (as of 3.0) is to center the pie so that all slices and data labels are within the plot area. As a consequence, the pie may actually jump around in a chart with dynamic values, as the data labels move. In that case, the center should be explicitly set, for example to ["50%", "50%"].

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.PlotOptionsPieCfg.BorderWidth
member.summary: The width of the border surrounding each slice.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.PlotOptionsPieCfg.BorderColor
member.summary: The color of the border surrounding each slice.

member.name: T:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.PlotOptionsPyramidCfg
member.summary: A pyramid chart consists of a single pyramid with item heights corresponding to each point value. Technically it is the same as a reversed funnel chart without a neck.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.PlotOptionsPyramidCfg.Reversed
member.summary: The pyramid is reversed by default, as opposed to the funnel, which shares the layout engine, and is not reversed.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.PlotOptionsScatterCfg.StickyTracking
member.summary: Sticky tracking of mouse events. When true, the mouseOut event on a series isn't triggered until the mouse moves over another series, or out of the plot area. When false, the mouseOut event on a series is triggered when the mouse leaves the area around the series' graph or markers. This also implies the tooltip. When stickyTracking is false and tooltip.shared is false, the tooltip will be hidden when moving the mouse between series.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.PlotOptionsScatterCfg.LineWidth
member.summary: The width of the line connecting the data points.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.PlotOptionsSeriesDataLabelsCfg.ZIndex
member.summary: The Z index of the data labels. The default Z index puts it above the series. Use a Z index of 2 to display it behind the series.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.PlotOptionsSeriesDataLabelsCfg.Y
member.summary: The y position offset of the label relative to the point.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.PlotOptionsSeriesDataLabelsCfg.X
member.summary: The x position offset of the label relative to the point.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.PlotOptionsSeriesDataLabelsCfg.VerticalAlign
member.summary: The vertical alignment of a data label. Can be one of top, middle or bottom. The default value depends on the data, for instance in a column chart, the label is above positive values and below negative values.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.PlotOptionsSeriesDataLabelsCfg.Style
member.summary: Styles for the label.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.PlotOptionsSeriesDataLabelsCfg.Step
member.summary: n/a for data labels

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.PlotOptionsSeriesDataLabelsCfg.StaggerLines
member.summary: n/a for data labels

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.PlotOptionsSeriesDataLabelsCfg.Shadow
member.summary: The shadow of the box. Works best with borderWidth or backgroundColor. Since 2.3 the shadow can be an object configuration containing color, offsetX, offsetY, opacity and width.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.PlotOptionsSeriesDataLabelsCfg.Rotation
member.summary: Text rotation in degrees. Note that due to a more complex structure, backgrounds and borders will be lost on a rotated data label.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.PlotOptionsSeriesDataLabelsCfg.Padding
member.summary: When either the borderWidth or the backgroundColor is set, this is the padding within the box.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.PlotOptionsSeriesDataLabelsCfg.Overflow
member.summary: How to handle data labels that flow outside the plot area. The default is justify, which aligns them inside the plot area. For columns and bars, this means it will be moved inside the bar. To display data labels outside the plot area, set crop to false and overflow to "none".

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.PlotOptionsSeriesDataLabelsCfg.Inside
member.summary: For points with an extent, like columns, whether to align the data label inside the box or to the actual value point. Defaults to false in most cases, true in stacked columns.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.PlotOptionsSeriesDataLabelsCfg.Formatter
member.summary:
Callback JavaScript function to format the data label. Note that if a format is defined, the format takes precedence and the formatter is ignored. Available data are:
this.percentage Stacked series and pies only. The point's percentage of the total.
this.point The point object. The point name, if defined, is available through this.point.name.
this.series: The series object. The series name is available through this.series.name.
this.total Stacked series only. The total value at this point's x value.
this.x: The x value.
this.y: The y value.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.PlotOptionsSeriesDataLabelsCfg.Format
member.summary: A format string for the data label. Available variables are the same as for formatter.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.PlotOptionsSeriesDataLabelsCfg.Enabled
member.summary: Enable or disable the data labels.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.PlotOptionsSeriesDataLabelsCfg.Defer
member.summary: Whether to defer displaying the data labels until the initial series animation has finished.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.PlotOptionsSeriesDataLabelsCfg.Crop
member.summary: Whether to hide data labels that are outside the plot area. By default, the data label is moved inside the plot area according to the overflow option.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.PlotOptionsSeriesDataLabelsCfg.Color
member.summary: The text color for the data labels. Defaults to null.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.PlotOptionsSeriesDataLabelsCfg.BorderWidth
member.summary: The border width in pixels for the data label.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.PlotOptionsSeriesDataLabelsCfg.BorderRadius
member.summary: The border radius in pixels for the data label.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.PlotOptionsSeriesDataLabelsCfg.BorderColor
member.summary: The border color for the data label. Defaults to undefined.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.PlotOptionsSeriesDataLabelsCfg.BackgroundColor
member.summary: The background color or gradient for the data label. Defaults to undefined.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.PlotOptionsSeriesDataLabelsCfg.Align
member.summary: The alignment of the data label compared to the point. Can be one of "left", "center" or "right". Defaults to "center".

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.PlotOptionsSeriesEventsCfg.Show
member.summary: Fires when the series is shown after chart generation time, either by clicking the legend item or by calling .show().

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.PlotOptionsSeriesEventsCfg.MouseOver
member.summary: Fires when the mouse enters the graph. The this keyword refers to the series object itself. One parameter, event, is passed to the function. This contains common event information based on jQuery or MooTools depending on which library is used as the base for Highcharts.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.PlotOptionsSeriesEventsCfg.MouseOut
member.summary: Fires when the mouse leaves the graph. The this keyword refers to the series object itself. One parameter, event, is passed to the function. This contains common event information based on jQuery or MooTools depending on which library is used as the base for Highcharts. If the stickyTracking option is true, mouseOut doesn't happen before the mouse enters another graph or leaves the plot area.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.PlotOptionsSeriesEventsCfg.LegendItemClick
member.summary: Fires when the legend item belonging to the series is clicked. The this keyword refers to the series object itself. One parameter, event, is passed to the function. This contains common event information based on jQuery or MooTools depending on which library is used as the base for Highcharts. The default action is to toggle the visibility of the series. This can be prevented by returning false or calling event.preventDefault().

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.PlotOptionsSeriesEventsCfg.Hide
member.summary: Fires when the series is hidden after chart generation time, either by clicking the legend item or by calling .hide().

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.PlotOptionsSeriesEventsCfg.Click
member.summary: Fires when the series is clicked. The this keyword refers to the series object itself. One parameter, event, is passed to the function. This contains common event information based on jQuery or MooTools depending on which library is used as the base for Highcharts. Additionally, event.point holds a pointer to the nearest point on the graph.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.PlotOptionsSeriesEventsCfg.CheckboxClick
member.summary: Fires when the checkbox next to the series' name in the legend is clicked.. The this keyword refers to the series object itself. One parameter, event, is passed to the function. The state of the checkbox is found by event.checked. Return false to prevent the default action which is to toggle the select state of the series.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.PlotOptionsSeriesEventsCfg.AfterAnimate
member.summary: Fires after the series has finished its initial animation, or in case animation is disabled, immediately as the series is displayed.

member.summary: The width of the point marker's outline.

member.summary: The color of the point marker's outline. When null, the series' or point's color is used.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.PlotOptionsSeriesMarkerCfg.Symbol
member.summary:
A predefined shape or symbol for the marker. When null, the symbol is pulled from options.symbols. Other possible values are "circle", "square", "diamond", "triangle" and "triangle-down".

Additionally, the URL to a graphic can be given on this form: "url(graphic.png)". Note that for the image to be applied to exported charts, its URL needs to be accessible by the export server.

Custom callbacks for symbol path generation can also be added to Highcharts.SVGRenderer.prototype.symbols. The callback is then used by its method name, as shown in the demo.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.PlotOptionsSeriesMarkerCfg.Radius
member.summary: The radius of the point marker.

member.summary: The width of the point marker's outline.

member.summary: The color of the point marker's outline. When null, the series' or point's color is used.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.PlotOptionsSeriesMarkerCfg.FillColor
member.summary: The fill color of the point marker. When null, the series' or point's color is used.

member.summary: Enable or disable the point marker.

member.summary: Events for each single point

member.summary: Fires when the point is updated programmatically through the .update() method. The this keyword refers to the point object itself. One parameter, event, is passed to the function. The new point options can be accessed through event.options. Returning false cancels the operation.

member.summary: Fires when the point is unselected either programmatically or following a click on the point. The this keyword refers to the point object itself. One parameter, event, is passed to the function. Returning false cancels the operation.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.PlotOptionsSeriesPointEventsCfg.Select
member.summary: Fires when the point is selected either programmatically or following a click on the point. The this keyword refers to the point object itself. One parameter, event, is passed to the function. Returning false cancels the operation.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.PlotOptionsSeriesPointEventsCfg.Remove
member.summary: Fires when the point is removed using the .remove() method. The this keyword refers to the point object itself. One parameter, event, is passed to the function. Returning false cancels the operation.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.PlotOptionsSeriesPointEventsCfg.MouseOver
member.summary: Fires when the mouse enters the area close to the point. The this keyword refers to the point object itself. One parameter, event, is passed to the function. This contains common event information based on jQuery or MooTools depending on which library is used as the base for Highcharts.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.PlotOptionsSeriesPointEventsCfg.MouseOut
member.summary: Fires when the mouse leaves the area close to the point. The this keyword refers to the point object itself. One parameter, event, is passed to the function. This contains common event information based on jQuery or MooTools depending on which library is used as the base for Highcharts.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.PlotOptionsSeriesPointEventsCfg.Click
member.summary:
Fires when a point is clicked. The this keyword refers to the point object itself. One parameter, event, is passed to the function. This contains common event information based on jQuery or MooTools depending on which library is used as the base for Highcharts.

If the series.allowPointSelect option is true, the default action for the point's click event is to toggle the point's select state. Returning false cancels this action.

member.name: T:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.PlotOptionsSeriesPointCfg
member.summary: Properties for each single point

member.name: T:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.PlotOptionsSeriesStatesHoverHaloCfg
member.summary: Options for the halo appearing around the hovered point in line-type series as well as outside the hovered slice in pie charts. By default the halo is filled by the current point or series color with an opacity of 0.25. The halo can be disabled by setting the halo option to false.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.PlotOptionsSeriesStatesHoverHaloCfg.Size
member.summary: The pixel size of the halo. For point markers this is the radius of the halo. For pie slices it is the width of the halo outside the slice. For bubbles it defaults to 5 and is the width of the halo outside the bubble.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.PlotOptionsSeriesStatesHoverHaloCfg.Opacity
member.summary: Opacity for the halo unless a specific fill is overridden using the attributes setting. Note that Highcharts is only able to apply opacity to colors of hex or rgb(a) formats.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.PlotOptionsSeriesStatesHoverHaloCfg.Attributes
member.summary: A collection of SVG attributes to override the appearance of the halo, for example fill, stroke and stroke-width.

member.name: T:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.PlotOptionsSeriesStatesHoverCfg
member.summary: Options for the hovered series

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.PlotOptionsSeriesStatesHoverCfg.LineWidthPlus
member.summary: The additional line width for the graph of a hovered series.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.PlotOptionsSeriesStatesHoverCfg.LineWidth
member.summary: Pixel with of the graph line.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.PlotOptionsSeriesStatesHoverCfg.Enabled
member.summary: Enable separate styles for the hovered series to visualize that the user hovers either the series itself or the legend. .

member.name: T:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.PlotOptionsSeriesStatesCfg
member.summary: A wrapper object for all the series options in specific states.

member.name: T:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.PlotOptionsSeriesTooltipCfg
member.summary: A configuration object for the tooltip rendering of each single series. Properties are inherited from tooltip, but only the following properties can be defined on a series level.

member.name: T:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.PlotOptionsSeriesCfg
member.summary: General options for all series types.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.PlotOptionsSeriesCfg.Visible
member.summary: Set the initial visibility of the series.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.PlotOptionsSeriesCfg.TurboThreshold
member.summary: When a series contains a data array that is longer than this, only one dimensional arrays of numbers, or two dimensional arrays with x and y values are allowed. Also, only the first point is tested, and the rest are assumed to be the same format. This saves expensive data checking and indexing in long series. Set it to 0 disable.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.PlotOptionsSeriesCfg.Threshold
member.summary: The threshold, also called zero level or base level. For line type series this is only used in conjunction with negativeColor.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.PlotOptionsSeriesCfg.StickyTracking
member.summary: Sticky tracking of mouse events. When true, the mouseOut event on a series isn't triggered until the mouse moves over another series, or out of the plot area. When false, the mouseOut event on a series is triggered when the mouse leaves the area around the series' graph or markers. This also implies the tooltip. When stickyTracking is false and tooltip.shared is false, the tooltip will be hidden when moving the mouse between series. Defaults to true for line and area type series, but to false for columns, pies etc.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.PlotOptionsSeriesCfg.Stacking
member.summary: Whether to stack the values of each series on top of each other. Possible values are null to disable, "normal" to stack by value or "percent".

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.PlotOptionsSeriesCfg.ShowInLegend
member.summary: Whether to display this particular series or series type in the legend. The default value is true for standalone series, false for linked series.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.PlotOptionsSeriesCfg.ShowCheckbox
member.summary: If true, a checkbox is displayed next to the legend item to allow selecting the series. The state of the checkbox is determined by the selected option.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.PlotOptionsSeriesCfg.Shadow
member.summary: Whether to apply a drop shadow to the graph line. Since 2.3 the shadow can be an object configuration containing color, offsetX, offsetY, opacity and width.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.PlotOptionsSeriesCfg.Selected
member.summary: Whether to select the series initially. If showCheckbox is true, the checkbox next to the series name will be checked for a selected series.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.PlotOptionsSeriesCfg.PointStart
member.summary: If no x values are given for the points in a series, pointStart defines on what value to start. For example, if a series contains one yearly value starting from 1945, set pointStart to 1945.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.PlotOptionsSeriesCfg.PointPlacement
member.summary:
Possible values: null, "on", "between".

In a column chart, when pointPlacement is "on", the point will not create any padding of the X axis. In a polar column chart this means that the first column points directly north. If the pointPlacement is "between", the columns will be laid out between ticks. This is useful for example for visualising an amount between two points in time or in a certain sector of a polar chart.

Since Highcharts 3.0.2, the point placement can also be numeric, where 0 is on the axis value, -0.5 is between this value and the previous, and 0.5 is between this value and the next. Unlike the textual options, numeric point placement options won't affect axis padding.

Defaults to null in cartesian charts, "between" in polar charts.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.PlotOptionsSeriesCfg.PointInterval
member.summary: If no x values are given for the points in a series, pointInterval defines the interval of the x values. For example, if a series contains one value every decade starting from year 0, set pointInterval to 10.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.PlotOptionsSeriesCfg.NegativeColor
member.summary: The color for the parts of the graph or points that are below the threshold.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.PlotOptionsSeriesCfg.LinkedTo
member.summary: The id of another series to link to. Additionally, the value can be ":previous" to link to the previous series. When two series are linked, only the first one appears in the legend. Toggling the visibility of this also toggles the linked series.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.PlotOptionsSeriesCfg.LineWidth
member.summary: Pixel with of the graph line.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.PlotOptionsSeriesCfg.EnableMouseTracking
member.summary: Enable or disable the mouse tracking for a specific series. This includes point tooltips and click events on graphs and points. For large datasets it improves performance.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.PlotOptionsSeriesCfg.DashStyle
member.summary:
A name for the dash style to use for the graph. Applies only to series type having a graph, like line, spline, area and scatter in case it has a lineWidth. The value for the dashStyle include:
  • Solid
  • ShortDash
  • ShortDot
  • ShortDashDot
  • ShortDashDotDot
  • Dot
  • Dash
  • LongDash
  • DashDot
  • LongDashDot
  • LongDashDotDot

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.PlotOptionsSeriesCfg.Cursor
member.summary: You can set the cursor to "pointer" if you have click events attached to the series, to signal to the user that the points and lines can be clicked.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.PlotOptionsSeriesCfg.CropThreshold
member.summary: When the series contains less points than the crop threshold, all points are drawn, event if the points fall outside the visible plot area at the current zoom. The advantage of drawing all points (including markers and columns), is that animation is performed on updates. On the other hand, when the series contains more points than the crop threshold, the series data is cropped to only contain points that fall within the plot area. The advantage of cropping away invisible points is to increase performance on large series. .

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.PlotOptionsSeriesCfg.ConnectNulls
member.summary: Whether to connect a graph line across null points.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.PlotOptionsSeriesCfg.ConnectEnds
member.summary: Polar charts only. Whether to connect the ends of a line series plot across the extremes.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.PlotOptionsSeriesCfg.Color
member.summary: The main color or the series. In line type series it applies to the line and the point markers unless otherwise specified. In bar type series it applies to the bars unless a color is specified per point. The default value is pulled from the options.colors array.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.PlotOptionsSeriesCfg.Animation
member.summary:
Enable or disable the initial animation when a series is displayed. The animation can also be set as a configuration object. Please note that this option only applies to the initial animation of the series itself. For other animations, see chart.animation and the animation parameter under the API methods. The following properties are supported:

duration
The duration of the animation in milliseconds.
easing
When using jQuery as the general framework, the easing can be set to linear or swing. More easing functions are available with the use of jQuery plug-ins, most notably the jQuery UI suite. See the jQuery docs. When using MooTools as the general framework, use the property name transition instead of easing.

Due to poor performance, animation is disabled in old IE browsers for column charts and polar charts.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.PlotOptionsSeriesCfg.AllowPointSelect
member.summary: Allow this series' points to be selected by clicking on the markers, bars or pie slices.

member.name: T:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.PlotOptionsSolidgaugeCfg
member.summary: A gauge showing values using a filled arc with colors indicating the value. The solid gauge plots values against the yAxis, which is extended with some color options, minColor, maxColor and stops, to control the color of the gauge itself.

member.name: T:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.PlotOptionsWaterfallCfg

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.PlotOptionsWaterfallCfg.UpColor

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.PlotOptionsWaterfallCfg.LineColor

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.PlotOptionsWaterfallCfg.BorderColor
member.summary: The color of the border of each waterfall column.

member.name: T:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.PlotOptionsCfg
member.summary:
The plotOptions is a wrapper object for config objects for each series type. The config objects for each series can also be overridden for each series item as given in the series array.

Configuration options for the series are given in three levels. Options for all series in a chart are given in the plotOptions.series object. Then options for all series of a specific type are given in the plotOptions of that type, for example plotOptions.line. Next, options for one single series are given in the series array.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.PlotOptionsCfg.Heatmap
member.summary: The heatmap series type. This series type is available both in Highcharts and Highmaps. See the Highmaps API for details.

member.name: T:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.SeriesDataEventsCfg
member.summary: Individual point events

member.name: T:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.SeriesDataCfg
member.summary:
An array of data points for the series. The points can be given in three ways:
  1. An array of numerical values. In this case, the numerical values will be interpreted as y values, and x values will be automatically calculated, either starting at 0 and incrementing by 1, or from pointStart and pointInterval given in the plotOptions. If the axis is has categories, these will be used. This option is not available for range series. Example: 
    data: [0, 5, 3, 5]

  2. An array of arrays with two values. In this case, the first value is the x value and the second is the y value. If the first value is a string, it is applied as the name of the point, and the x value is incremented following the above rules.

    For range series, the arrays will be interpreted as [x, low, high]. In this cases, the X value can be skipped altogether to make use of pointStart and pointRange.

    Example: 
    data: [[5, 2], [6, 3], [8, 2]]

  3. An array of objects with named values. In this case the objects are point configuration objects as seen below.

    Range series values are given by low and high.

    Example: 
    data: [{
	name: 'Point 1',
	color: '#00FF00',
	y: 0
}, {
	name: 'Point 2',
	color: '#FF00FF',
	y: 5
}]

Note that line series and derived types like spline and area, require data to be sorted by X because it interpolates mouse coordinates for the tooltip. Column and scatter series, where each point has its own mouse event, does not require sorting.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.SeriesDataCfg.Y
member.summary: The y value of the point.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.SeriesDataCfg.X

member.summary: Waterfall series only. When this property is true, the points acts as a summary column for the values added or substracted since the last intermediate sum, or since the start of the series. The y value is ignored.

For example, even though a general lineWidth is specified in plotOptions.series, an individual lineWidth can be specified for each series.

member.summary: When using dual or multiple x axes, this number defines which xAxis the particular series is connected to. It refers to either the axis id or the index of the axis in the xAxis array, with 0 being the first.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.SeriesCfg.Type
member.summary: The type of series. Can be one of area, areaspline, bar, column, line, pie, scatter or spline. From version 2.3, arearange, areasplinerange and columnrange are supported with the highcharts-more.js component.
