member.name: T:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.TooltipCfg
member.summary: Options for the tooltip that appears when the user hovers over a series or point.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.TooltipCfg.XDateFormat
member.summary: The format for the date in the tooltip header if the X axis is a datetime axis. The default is a best guess based on the smallest distance between points in the chart.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.TooltipCfg.ValueSuffix
member.summary: A string to append to each series' y value. Overridable in each series' tooltip options object.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.TooltipCfg.ValuePrefix
member.summary: A string to prepend to each series' y value. Overridable in each series' tooltip options object.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.TooltipCfg.ValueDecimals
member.summary: How many decimals to show in each series' y value. This is overridable in each series' tooltip options object. The default is to preserve all decimals.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.TooltipCfg.UseHTML
member.summary: Use HTML to render the contents of the tooltip instead of SVG. Using HTML allows advanced formatting like tables and images in the tooltip. It is also recommended for rtl languages as it works around rtl bugs in early Firefox.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.TooltipCfg.Style
member.summary:
CSS styles for the tooltip. The tooltip can also be styled through the CSS class .highcharts-tooltip. Default value: 
style: {
	color: '#333333',
	fontSize: '12px',
	padding: '8px'
}

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.TooltipCfg.Snap
member.summary: Proximity snap for graphs or single points. Does not apply to bars, columns and pie slices. It defaults to 10 for mouse-powered devices and 25 for touch devices.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.TooltipCfg.Shared
member.summary: When the tooltip is shared, the entire plot area will capture mouse movement. Tooltip texts for series types with ordered data (not pie, scatter, flags etc) will be shown in a single bubble. This is recommended for single series charts and for tablet/mobile optimized charts.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.TooltipCfg.Shape
member.summary: The name of a symbol to use for the border around the tooltip. In Highcharts 3.x and less, the shape was square.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.TooltipCfg.Shadow
member.summary: Whether to apply a drop shadow to the tooltip.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.TooltipCfg.Positioner
member.summary:
A callback function to place the tooltip in a default position. The callback receives three parameters: labelWidth, labelHeight and point, where point contains values for plotX and plotY telling where the reference point is in the plot area. Add chart.plotLeft and chart.plotTop to get the full coordinates.

The return should be an object containing x and y values, for example { x: 100, y: 100 }.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.TooltipCfg.PointFormat
member.summary: The HTML of the point's line in the tooltip. Variables are enclosed by curly brackets. Available variables are point.x, point.y, series.name and series.color and other properties on the same form. Furthermore, point.y can be extended by the tooltip.yPrefix and tooltip.ySuffix variables. This can also be overridden for each series, which makes it a good hook for displaying units.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.TooltipCfg.HideDelay
member.summary: The number of milliseconds to wait until the tooltip is hidden when mouse out from a point or chart.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.TooltipCfg.HeaderFormat
member.summary:
The HTML of the tooltip header line. Variables are enclosed by curly brackets. Available variables are point.key, series.name, series.color and other members from the point and series objects. The point.key variable contains the category name, x value or datetime string depending on the type of axis. For datetime axes, the point.key date format can be set using tooltip.xDateFormat.

Defaults to <span style="font-size: 10px">{point.key}</span><br/>

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.TooltipCfg.Formatter
member.summary:
Callback function to format the text of the tooltip. Return false to disable tooltip for a specific point on series.

A subset of HTML is supported. The HTML of the tooltip is parsed and converted to SVG, therefore this isn't a complete HTML renderer. The following tabs are supported: <b>, <strong>, <i>, <em>, <br/>, <span>. Spans can be styled with a style attribute, but only text-related CSS that is shared with SVG is handled.

Since version 2.1 the tooltip can be shared between multiple series through the shared option. The available data in the formatter differ a bit depending on whether the tooltip is shared or not. In a shared tooltip, all properties except x, which is common for all points, are kept in an array, this.points.

Available data are:

this.percentage (not shared) / this.points[i].percentage (shared)
Stacked series and pies only. The point's percentage of the total.
this.point (not shared) / this.points[i].point (shared)
The point object. The point name, if defined, is available through this.point.name.
this.points
In a shared tooltip, this is an array containing all other properties for each point.
this.series (not shared) / this.points[i].series (shared)
The series object. The series name is available through this.series.name.
this.total (not shared) / this.points[i].total (shared)
Stacked series only. The total value at this point's x value.
this.x
The x value. This property is the same regardless of the tooltip being shared or not.
this.y (not shared) / this.points[i].y (shared)
The y value.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.TooltipCfg.FooterFormat
member.summary: A string to append to the tooltip format.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.TooltipCfg.FollowTouchMove
member.summary: Whether the tooltip should follow the finger as it moves on a touch device. The default value of false causes a touch move to scroll the web page, as is default behaviour on touch devices. Setting it to true may cause the user to be trapped inside the chart and unable to scroll away, so it should be used with care. If chart.zoomType is set, it will override followTouchMove

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.TooltipCfg.FollowPointer
member.summary:
Whether the tooltip should follow the mouse as it moves across columns, pie slices and other point types with an extent. By default it behaves this way for scatter, bubble and pie series by override in the plotOptions for those series types.

For touch moves to behave the same way, followTouchMove must be true also.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.TooltipCfg.Enabled
member.summary: Enable or disable the tooltip.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.TooltipCfg.DateTimeLabelFormats
member.summary:
For series on a datetime axes, the date format in the tooltip's header will by default be guessed based on the closest data points. This member gives the default string representations used for each unit. For an overview of the replacement codes, see dateFormat.

Defaults to: 

{
    millisecond:"%A, %b %e, %H:%M:%S.%L",
    second:"%A, %b %e, %H:%M:%S",
    minute:"%A, %b %e, %H:%M",
    hour:"%A, %b %e, %H:%M",
    day:"%A, %b %e, %Y",
    week:"Week from %A, %b %e, %Y",
    month:"%B %Y",
    year:"%Y"
}

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.TooltipCfg.Crosshairs
member.summary:
Display crosshairs to connect the points with their corresponding axis values. The crosshairs can be defined as a boolean, an array of booleans or an object.
Boolean
If the crosshairs option is true, a single crosshair relating to the x axis will be shown.
Array of booleans
In an array of booleans, the first value turns on the x axis crosshair and the second value to the y axis crosshair. Use [true, true] to show complete crosshairs.
Array of objects
In an array of objects, the first value applies to the x axis crosshair and the second value to the y axis crosshair. For each dimension, a width, color, dashStyle and zIndex can be given.
Defaults to null.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.TooltipCfg.BorderWidth
member.summary: The pixel width of the tooltip border.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.TooltipCfg.BorderRadius
member.summary: The radius of the rounded border corners.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.TooltipCfg.BorderColor
member.summary: The color of the tooltip border. When null, the border takes the color of the corresponding series or point.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.TooltipCfg.BackgroundColor
member.summary: The background color or gradient for the tooltip.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.TooltipCfg.Animation
member.summary: Enable or disable animation of the tooltip. In slow legacy IE browsers the animation is disabled by default.

member.name: T:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.XAxisEventsCfg
member.summary: Event handlers for the axis.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.XAxisEventsCfg.SetExtremes
member.summary:
Fires when the minimum and maximum is set for the axis, either by calling the .setExtremes() method or by selecting an area in the chart. The this keyword refers to the axis object itself. One parameter, event, is passed to the function. This contains common event information based on jQuery or MooTools depending on which library is used as the base for Highcharts.

The new user set minimum and maximum values can be found by event.min and event.max. When an axis is zoomed all the way out from the "Reset zoom" button, event.min and event.max are null, and the new extremes are set based on this.dataMin and this.dataMax.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.XAxisEventsCfg.AfterSetExtremes
member.summary: As opposed to the setExtremes event, this event fires after the final min and max values are computed and corrected for minRange.

member.summary: The axis labels show the number or category for each tick.

member.summary: The Z index for the axis labels.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.XAxisLabelsCfg.Y
member.summary: The y position offset of the label relative to the tick position on the axis. The default makes it adapt to the font size on bottom axis.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.XAxisLabelsCfg.X
member.summary: The x position offset of the label relative to the tick position on the axis.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.XAxisLabelsCfg.UseHTML

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.XAxisLabelsCfg.Style
P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.XAxisLabelsCfg.Step
member.summary:
To show only every n'th label on the axis, set the step to n. Setting the step to 2 shows every other label.

By default, the step is calculated automatically to avoid overlap. To prevent this, set it to 1. This usually only happens on a category axis, and is often a sign that you have chosen the wrong axis type. Read more at Axis docs => What axis should I use?

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.XAxisLabelsCfg.StaggerLines
member.summary: Horizontal axes only. The number of lines to spread the labels over to make room or tighter labels. .

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.XAxisLabelsCfg.Overflow
member.summary: How to handle overflowing labels on horizontal axis. Can be undefined, false or "justify". By default it aligns inside the chart area. If "justify", labels will not render outside the plot area. If false, it will not be aligned at all. If there is room to move it, it will be aligned to the edge, else it will be removed.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.XAxisLabelsCfg.MaxStaggerLines
member.summary: Horizontal axis only. When staggerLines is not set, maxStaggerLines defines how many lines the axis is allowed to add to automatically avoid overlapping X labels. Set to 1 to disable overlap detection.

member.summary: CSS styles for the title. When titles are rotated they are rendered using vector graphic techniques and not all styles are applicable.

member.summary: The rotation of the text in degrees. 0 is horizontal, 270 is vertical reading from bottom to top.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.XAxisTitleCfg.Offset
member.summary: The distance of the axis title from the axis line. By default, this distance is computed from the offset width of the labels, the labels' distance from the axis and the title's margin. However when the offset option is set, it overrides all this.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.XAxisTitleCfg.Margin
member.summary: The pixel distance between the axis labels or line and the title. Defaults to 0 for horizontal axes, 10 for vertical

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.XAxisTitleCfg.Align
member.summary: Alignment of the title relative to the axis values. Possible values are "low", "middle" or "high".

member.name: T:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.XAxisCfg
member.summary:
The X axis or category axis. Normally this is the horizontal axis, though if the chart is inverted this is the vertical axis. In case of multiple axes, the xAxis node is an array of configuration objects.

See the Axis object for programmatic access to the axis.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.XAxisCfg.Type
member.summary: The type of axis. Can be one of "linear", "logarithmic", "datetime" or "category". In a datetime axis, the numbers are given in milliseconds, and tick marks are placed on appropriate values like full hours or days. In a category axis, the point names of the chart's series are used for categories, if not a categories array is defined.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.XAxisCfg.TickmarkPlacement
member.summary: For categorized axes only. If "on" the tick mark is placed in the center of the category, if "between" the tick mark is placed between categories.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.XAxisCfg.TickWidth
member.summary: The pixel width of the major tick marks.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.XAxisCfg.TickPositions
member.summary: An array defining where the ticks are laid out on the axis. This overrides the default behaviour of tickPixelInterval and tickInterval.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.XAxisCfg.TickPositioner
member.summary: A callback function returning array defining where the ticks are laid out on the axis. This overrides the default behaviour of tickPixelInterval and tickInterval.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.XAxisCfg.TickPosition
member.summary: The position of the major tick marks relative to the axis line. Can be one of inside and outside.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.XAxisCfg.TickPixelInterval
member.summary: If tickInterval is null this option sets the approximate pixel interval of the tick marks. Not applicable to categorized axis. Defaults to 72 for the Y axis and 100 for the X axis.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.XAxisCfg.TickLength
member.summary: The pixel length of the main tick marks.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.XAxisCfg.TickInterval
member.summary:
The interval of the tick marks in axis units. When null, the tick interval is computed to approximately follow the tickPixelInterval on linear and datetime axes. On categorized axes, a null tickInterval will default to 1, one category. Note that datetime axes are based on milliseconds, so for example an interval of one day is expressed as 24 * 3600 * 1000.

On logarithmic axes, the tickInterval is based on powers, so a tickInterval of 1 means one tick on each of 0.1, 1, 10, 100 etc. A tickInterval of 2 means a tick of 0.1, 10, 1000 etc. A tickInterval of 0.2 puts a tick on 0.1, 0.2, 0.4, 0.6, 0.8, 1, 2, 4, 6, 8, 10, 20, 40 etc.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.XAxisCfg.TickColor
member.summary: Color for the main tick marks.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.XAxisCfg.StartOnTick
member.summary: Whether to force the axis to start on a tick. Use this option with the maxPadding option to control the axis start.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.XAxisCfg.StartOfWeek
member.summary: For datetime axes, this decides where to put the tick between weeks. 0 = Sunday, 1 = Monday.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.XAxisCfg.ShowLastLabel
member.summary: Whether to show the last tick label.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.XAxisCfg.ShowFirstLabel
member.summary: Whether to show the first tick label.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.XAxisCfg.ShowEmpty
member.summary: Whether to show the axis line and title when the axis has no data.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.XAxisCfg.Reversed
member.summary: Whether to reverse the axis so that the highest number is closest to the origin. If the chart is inverted, the x axis is reversed by default.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.XAxisCfg.Opposite
member.summary: Whether to display the axis on the opposite side of the normal. The normal is on the left side for vertical axes and bottom for horizontal, so the opposite sides will be right and top respectively. This is typically used with dual or multiple axes.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.XAxisCfg.Offset
member.summary: The distance in pixels from the plot area to the axis line. A positive offset moves the axis with it's line, labels and ticks away from the plot area. This is typically used when two or more axes are displayed on the same side of the plot.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.XAxisCfg.MinorTickWidth
member.summary: The pixel width of the minor tick mark.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.XAxisCfg.MinorTickPosition
member.summary: The position of the minor tick marks relative to the axis line. Can be one of inside and outside.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.XAxisCfg.MinorTickLength
member.summary: The pixel length of the minor tick marks.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.XAxisCfg.MinorTickInterval
member.summary:
Tick interval in scale units for the minor ticks. On a linear axis, if "auto", the minor tick interval is calculated as a fifth of the tickInterval. If null, minor ticks are not shown.

On logarithmic axes, the unit is the power of the value. For example, setting the minorTickInterval to 1 puts one tick on each of 0.1, 1, 10, 100 etc. Setting the minorTickInterval to 0.1 produces 9 ticks between 1 and 10, 10 and 100 etc. A minorTickInterval of "auto" on a log axis results in a best guess, attempting to enter approximately 5 minor ticks between each major tick.

On axes using categories, minor ticks are not supported.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.XAxisCfg.MinorTickColor
member.summary: Color for the minor tick marks.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.XAxisCfg.MinorGridLineWidth
member.summary: Width of the minor, secondary grid lines.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.XAxisCfg.MinorGridLineDashStyle
member.summary: The dash or dot style of the minor grid lines. For possible values, see this demonstration.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.XAxisCfg.MinorGridLineColor
member.summary: Color of the minor, secondary grid lines.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.XAxisCfg.MinTickInterval
member.summary: The minimum tick interval allowed in axis values. For example on zooming in on an axis with daily data, this can be used to prevent the axis from showing hours.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.XAxisCfg.MinRange
member.summary:
The minimum range to display on this axis. The entire axis will not be allowed to span over a smaller interval than this. For example, for a datetime axis the main unit is milliseconds. If minRange is set to 3600000, you can't zoom in more than to one hour.

The default minRange for the x axis is five times the smallest interval between any of the data points.

On a logarithmic axis, the unit for the minimum range is the power. So a minRange of 1 means that the axis can be zoomed to 10-100, 100-1000, 1000-10000 etc.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.XAxisCfg.MinPadding
member.summary: Padding of the min value relative to the length of the axis. A padding of 0.05 will make a 100px axis 5px longer. This is useful when you don't want the lowest data value to appear on the edge of the plot area. When the axis' min option is set or a min extreme is set using axis.setExtremes(), the minPadding will be ignored.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.XAxisCfg.Min
member.summary: The minimum value of the axis. If null the min value is automatically calculated. If the startOnTick option is true, the min value might be rounded down.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.XAxisCfg.MaxPadding
member.summary: Padding of the max value relative to the length of the axis. A padding of 0.05 will make a 100px axis 5px longer. This is useful when you don't want the highest data value to appear on the edge of the plot area. When the axis' max option is set or a max extreme is set using axis.setExtremes(), the maxPadding will be ignored.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.XAxisCfg.Max
member.summary: The maximum value of the axis. If null, the max value is automatically calculated. If the endOnTick option is true, the max value might be rounded up. The actual maximum value is also influenced by chart.alignTicks.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.XAxisCfg.LinkedTo
member.summary: Index of another axis that this axis is linked to. When an axis is linked to a master axis, it will take the same extremes as the master, but as assigned by min or max or by setExtremes. It can be used to show additional info, or to ease reading the chart by duplicating the scales.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.XAxisCfg.LineWidth
member.summary: The width of the line marking the axis itself.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.XAxisCfg.LineColor
member.summary: The color of the line marking the axis itself.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.XAxisCfg.Id
member.summary: An id for the axis. This can be used after render time to get a pointer to the axis object through chart.get().

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.XAxisCfg.GridZIndex
member.summary: The Z index of the grid lines.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.XAxisCfg.GridLineWidth
member.summary: The width of the grid lines extending the ticks across the plot area.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.XAxisCfg.GridLineDashStyle
member.summary: The dash or dot style of the grid lines. For possible values, see this demonstration.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.XAxisCfg.GridLineColor
member.summary: Color of the grid lines extending the ticks across the plot area.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.XAxisCfg.Floor
member.summary: The lowest allowed value for automatically computed axis extremes.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.XAxisCfg.EndOnTick
member.summary: Whether to force the axis to end on a tick. Use this option with the maxPadding option to control the axis end.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.XAxisCfg.DateTimeLabelFormats
member.summary:
For a datetime axis, the scale will automatically adjust to the appropriate unit. This member gives the default string representations used for each unit. For an overview of the replacement codes, see dateFormat. Defaults to: 
{
	millisecond: '%H:%M:%S.%L',
	second: '%H:%M:%S',
	minute: '%H:%M',
	hour: '%H:%M',
	day: '%e. %b',
	week: '%e. %b',
	month: '%b \'%y',
	year: '%Y'
}

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.XAxisCfg.Ceiling
member.summary: The highest allowed value for automatically computed axis extremes.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.XAxisCfg.Categories
member.summary:
If categories are present for the xAxis, names are used instead of numbers for that axis. Since Highcharts 3.0, categories can also be extracted by giving each point a name and setting axis type to "category".

Example: 

categories: ['Apples', 'Bananas', 'Oranges']
Defaults to null

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.XAxisCfg.AlternateGridColor
member.summary: When using an alternate grid color, a band is painted across the plot area between every other grid line.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.XAxisCfg.AllowDecimals
member.summary: Whether to allow decimals in this axis' ticks. When counting integers, like persons or hits on a web page, decimals must be avoided in the axis tick labels.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.YAxisLabelsCfg.Y
member.summary: The y position offset of the label relative to the tick position on the axis.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.YAxisLabelsCfg.X
member.summary: The x position offset of the label relative to the tick position on the axis. Defaults to -15 for left axis, 15 for right axis.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.YAxisLabelsCfg.Align
member.summary: What part of the string the given position is anchored to. Can be one of "left", "center" or "right".

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.YAxisPlotBandsCfg.Thickness
member.summary: In a gauge chart, this option sets the width of the plot band stretching along the perimeter. It can be given as a percentage string, like "10%", or as a pixel number, like 10. The default value 10 is the same as the default tickLength, thus making the plot band act as a background for the tick markers.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.YAxisPlotBandsCfg.OuterRadius
member.summary: In a gauge chart, this option determines the outer radius of the plot band that stretches along the perimeter. It can be given as a percentage string, like "100%", or as a pixel number, like 100.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.YAxisPlotBandsCfg.InnerRadius
member.summary: In a gauge chart, this option determines the inner radius of the plot band that stretches along the perimeter. It can be given as a percentage string, like "100%", or as a pixel number, like 100. By default, the inner radius is controlled by the thickness option.

member.name: T:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.YAxisStackLabelsCfg
member.summary: The stack labels show the total value for each bar in a stacked column or bar chart. The label will be placed on top of positive columns and below negative columns. In case of an inverted column chart or a bar chart the label is placed to the right of positive bars and to the left of negative bars.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.YAxisStackLabelsCfg.Y
member.summary: The y position offset of the label relative to the tick position on the axis. The default value is calculated at runtime and depends on orientation and whether the stack is positive or negative.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.YAxisStackLabelsCfg.X
member.summary: The x position offset of the label relative to the left of the stacked bar. The default value is calculated at runtime and depends on orientation and whether the stack is positive or negative.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.YAxisStackLabelsCfg.VerticalAlign
member.summary: Defines the vertical alignment of the stack total label. Can be one of "top", "middle" or "bottom". The default value is calculated at runtime and depends on orientation and whether the stack is positive or negative.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.YAxisStackLabelsCfg.UseHTML
member.summary: Whether to use HTML to render the labels.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.YAxisStackLabelsCfg.TextAlign
member.summary: The text alignment for the label. While align determines where the texts anchor point is placed with regards to the stack, textAlign determines how the text is aligned against its anchor point. Possible values are "left", "center" and "right". The default value is calculated at runtime and depends on orientation and whether the stack is positive or negative.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.YAxisStackLabelsCfg.Style
member.summary:
CSS styles for the label. Defaults to: 
style: {
	color: '#666',
	'font-size': '11px',
	'line-height': '14px'
}

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.YAxisStackLabelsCfg.Rotation
member.summary: Rotation of the labels in degrees.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.YAxisStackLabelsCfg.Formatter
P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.YAxisStackLabelsCfg.Format
member.summary: A format string for the data label. Available variables are the same as for formatter.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.YAxisStackLabelsCfg.Enabled
member.summary: Enable or disable the stack total labels.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.YAxisStackLabelsCfg.Align
member.summary: Defines the horizontal alignment of the stack total label. Can be one of "left", "center" or "right". The default value is calculated at runtime and depends on orientation and whether the stack is positive or negative.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.YAxisTitleCfg.Text
member.summary: The actual text of the axis title. Horizontal texts can contain HTML, but rotated texts are painted using vector techniques and must be clean text. The Y axis title is disabled by setting the text option to null.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.YAxisTitleCfg.Rotation
member.summary: The rotation of the text in degrees. 0 is horizontal, 270 is vertical reading from bottom to top.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.YAxisTitleCfg.Margin
member.summary: The pixel distance between the axis labels and the title. Positive values are outside the axis line, negative are inside.

member.name: T:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.YAxisCfg
member.summary:
The Y axis or value axis. Normally this is the vertical axis, though if the chart is inverted this is the horizontal axis. In case of multiple axes, the yAxis node is an array of configuration objects.

See the Axis object for programmatic access to the axis.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.YAxisCfg.TickWidth
member.summary: The pixel width of the major tick marks.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.YAxisCfg.Stops
member.summary:
Solid gauge series only. Color stops for the solid gauge. Use this in cases where a linear gradient between a minColor and maxColor is not sufficient. The stops is an array of tuples, where the first item is a float between 0 and 1 assigning the relative position in the gradient, and the second item is the color.

For solid gauges, the Y axis also inherits the concept of data classes from the Highmaps color axis.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.YAxisCfg.StartOnTick
member.summary: Whether to force the axis to start on a tick. Use this option with the maxPadding option to control the axis start.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.YAxisCfg.ShowLastLabel
member.summary: Whether to show the last tick label.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.YAxisCfg.ReversedStacks
member.summary: If true, the first series in a stack will be drawn on top in a positive, non-reversed Y axis. If false, the first series is in the base of the stack.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.YAxisCfg.MinPadding
member.summary: Padding of the min value relative to the length of the axis. A padding of 0.05 will make a 100px axis 5px longer. This is useful when you don't want the lowest data value to appear on the edge of the plot area.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.YAxisCfg.MinColor
member.summary: Solid gauge only. Unless stops are set, the color to represent the minimum value of the Y axis.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.YAxisCfg.MaxPadding
member.summary: Padding of the max value relative to the length of the axis. A padding of 0.05 will make a 100px axis 5px longer. This is useful when you don't want the highest data value to appear on the edge of the plot area.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.YAxisCfg.MaxColor
member.summary: Solid gauge only. Unless stops are set, the color to represent the maximum value of the Y axis.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.YAxisCfg.LineWidth
member.summary: The width of the line marking the axis itself.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.YAxisCfg.GridLineWidth
member.summary: The width of the grid lines extending the ticks across the plot area.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.YAxisCfg.GridLineInterpolation
member.summary: Polar charts only. Whether the grid lines should draw as a polygon with straight lines between categories, or as circles. Can be either circle or polygon.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.YAxisCfg.EndOnTick
member.summary: Whether to force the axis to end on a tick. Use this option with the maxPadding option to control the axis end.

member.name: T:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.GlobalCfg
P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.GlobalCfg.UseUTC
member.summary: Whether to use UTC time for axis scaling, tickmark placement and time display in Highcharts.dateFormat. Advantages of using UTC is that the time displays equally regardless of the user agent's time zone settings. Local time can be used when the data is loaded in real time or when correct Daylight Saving Time transitions are required.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.GlobalCfg.TimezoneOffset
member.summary: The timezone offset in minutes. Positive values are west, negative values are east of UTC, as in the ECMAScript getTimezoneOffset method. Use this to display UTC based data in a predefined time zone.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.GlobalCfg.CanvasToolsURL
member.summary: The URL to the additional file to lazy load for Android 2.x devices. These devices don't support SVG, so we download a helper file that contains canvg, its dependency rbcolor, and our own CanVG Renderer class. To avoid hotlinking to our site, you can install canvas-tools.js on your own server and change this option accordingly.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.GlobalCfg.VMLRadialGradientURL
member.summary: Path to the pattern image required by VML browsers in order to draw radial gradients.

member.name: T:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.LangCfg
P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.LangCfg.Weekdays
member.summary: An array containing the weekday names.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.LangCfg.ThousandsSep
member.summary: The default thousands separator used in the Highcharts.numberFormat method unless otherwise specified in the function arguments. Defaults to ",".

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.LangCfg.ShortMonths
member.summary: An array containing the months names in abbreviated form. Corresponds to the %b format in Highcharts.dateFormat().

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.LangCfg.ResetZoom
member.summary: The text for the label appearing when a chart is zoomed.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.LangCfg.PrintChart
member.summary: Exporting module only. The text for the menu item to print the chart.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.LangCfg.NumericSymbols
member.summary: Metric prefixes used to shorten high numbers in axis labels. Replacing any of the positions with null causes the full number to be written. Setting numericSymbols to null disables shortening altogether.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.LangCfg.NoData
member.summary: The text to display when the chart contains no data. Requires the no-data module, see noData.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.LangCfg.Months
member.summary: An array containing the months names. Corresponds to the %B format in Highcharts.dateFormat().

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.LangCfg.Loading
member.summary: The loading text that appears when the chart is set into the loading state following a call to chart.showLoading.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.LangCfg.DrillUpText
member.summary: The text for the button that appears when drilling down, linking back to the parent series. The parent series' name is inserted for {series.name}.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.LangCfg.DownloadSVG
member.summary: Exporting module only. The text for the SVG download menu item.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.LangCfg.DownloadPNG
member.summary: Exporting module only. The text for the PNG download menu item.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.LangCfg.DownloadPDF
member.summary: Exporting module only. The text for the PDF download menu item.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.LangCfg.DownloadJPEG
member.summary: Exporting module only. The text for the JPEG download menu item.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.LangCfg.DecimalPoint
member.summary: The default decimal point used in the Highcharts.numberFormat method unless otherwise specified in the function arguments.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.WebSharper.Highcharts.LangCfg.ContextButtonTitle
